chargeHist.descr: Arson of Property Other Than Building

result.execSummary:
The defendant Angel Estrella was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Attempt Arson of Property Other Than Building, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.03.
  • Negligent Handling of Burning Material, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.10(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the DNA surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections, during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
- DV surcharge does not apply.
Restitution set at zero.
No firearms; weapons (during period of probation).

No contact with victims, Juana R. or Ervin R., without approval of the agent.
Defendant must be in BIP and doing well before any amendment to order.

Successfully complete Batterers Intervention counseling and continue programming.
Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
Attend and complete parenting classes.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
Maintain absolute sobriety. No drugs. No alcohol.

Court will grant request IF approved by the agent.

The Court finds that the defendant has not been complying with the conditions of probation.  The Court ordered the defendant to serve 5 DAYS of the condition time that was stayed to today's date; the stay on the balance of the time is to continue to the next court date. Case adjourned to 11-13-2015 at 1:30 p.m. for probation review hearing in Branch 38.  mld

  DOC agent Juana Flores also in court.

Defendant Angel Estrella in court with attorney Richard J. Smith.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sworn as Spanish Interpreter: Brenda Barthomomew.
The Court finds that the State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO AMENDED COUNT #1: Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to count #2), in the House of Correction with credit for 91 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 YEARS. 

AS TO AMENDED COUNT #2: Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to count #1), in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 40 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victims, Juana R or Ervin R., 
   without approval of the agent.    
   Defendant must be in BIP 
   and doing well before any amendment to order.
* Obtain and maintain employment.  
* No firearms; weapons (during period of probation).
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the DNA surcharge, 
   and supervision fees as determined by the 
   Department of Corrections, during period of 
   probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
   --- dv surcharge does not apply.  
* Restitution is set at zero.
**COURT ORDERED PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 4 ON 4-3-2015 AT 1:30 PM. 
Appeal rights given. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. Copy given to defendant.

Defendant Angel Estrella in court with attorney Richard J. Smith.  Defendant Angel Estrella in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sworn as Spanish Interpreter: Enrique Barbosa.

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT #3, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO AMENDED COUNTS #1 and #2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.   Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 1-16-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including the no contact order and no violations of the law until further order of the Court.   mld

Defendant Angel Estrella in court with attorney Richard J. Smith.  Defendant Angel Estrella in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 received and filed.
*
COUNT 1: ATTEMPT ARSON OF PROPERTY OTHER THAN BUILDING, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.03 and 939.32, a Class A Misdemeanor (per the State).    
*
COUNT 2: NEGLIGENT HANDLING OF BURNING MATERIAL, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 941.10(1) and 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.   
Amendment of charges now makes this a misdemeanor case.   mld
